segments.en: Linked Discourses 11
2. The Second Chapter
14. Poor

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
“Mendicants!”
“Venerable sir,” they replied.
The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “Bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, aññataro puriso imasmiṃyeva rājagahe manussadaliddo ahosi manussakapaṇo manussavarāko.
segments.en: “Once upon a time, mendicants, there was a poor person, impoverished and pitiful.

segments.pli: So tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye saddhaṃ samādiyi, sīlaṃ samādiyi, sutaṃ samādiyi, cāgaṃ samādiyi, paññaṃ samādiyi.
segments.en: They took up faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.

segments.pli: So tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye saddhaṃ samādiyitvā sīlaṃ samādiyitvā sutaṃ samādiyitvā cāgaṃ samādiyitvā paññaṃ samādiyitvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajji devānaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ sahabyataṃ.
segments.en: After undertaking these things, when their body broke up, after death, they were reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm, in the company of the gods of the Thirty-Three.

segments.pli: So aññe deve atirocati vaṇṇena ceva yasasā ca.
segments.en: There they outshone the other gods in beauty and glory.

segments.pli: Tatra sudaṃ, bhikkhave, devā tāvatiṃsā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti:
segments.en: But the gods of the Thirty-Three complained, grumbled, and objected,
‘It’s incredible, it’s amazing!

segments.pli: Ayañhi devaputto pubbe manussabhūto samāno manussadaliddo ahosi manussakapaṇo manussavarāko;
segments.en: For when this god was a human being in their past life they were poor, impoverished, and pitiful.

segments.pli: so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapanno devānaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ sahabyataṃ.
segments.en: And when their body broke up, after death, they were reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm, in the company of the gods of the Thirty-Three.

segments.pli: So aññe deve atirocati vaṇṇena ceva yasasā cā’ti.
segments.en: Here they outshine the other gods in beauty and glory.’

segments.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, sakko devānamindo deve tāvatiṃse āmantesi:
segments.en: Then Sakka, lord of gods, addressed the gods of the Thirty-Three,

segments.pli: ‘mā kho tumhe, mārisā, etassa devaputtassa ujjhāyittha.
segments.en: ‘Good sirs, don’t complain about this god.

segments.pli: Eso kho, mārisā, devaputto pubbe manussabhūto samāno tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye saddhaṃ samādiyi, sīlaṃ samādiyi, sutaṃ samādiyi, cāgaṃ samādiyi, paññaṃ samādiyi.
segments.en: When this god was a human being in their past life they took up faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.

segments.pli: So tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye saddhaṃ samādiyitvā sīlaṃ samādiyitvā sutaṃ samādiyitvā cāgaṃ samādiyitvā paññaṃ samādiyitvā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapanno devānaṃ tāvatiṃsānaṃ sahabyataṃ.
segments.en: After undertaking these things, when their body broke up, after death, they’ve been reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm, in the company of the gods of the Thirty-Three.

segments.pli: So aññe deve atirocati vaṇṇena ceva yasasā cā’ti.
segments.en: Here they outshine the other gods in beauty and glory.’

segments.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, sakko devānamindo deve tāvatiṃse anunayamāno tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imā gāthāyo abhāsi:
segments.en: Then Sakka, lord of gods, guiding the gods of the Thirty-Three, recited this verse:
‘Whoever has faith in the Realized One,
unwavering and well grounded;
whose ethical conduct is good,
praised and loved by the noble ones;
who has confidence in the Saṅgha,
and correct view:
they’re said to be prosperous,
their life is not in vain.
So let the wise devote themselves
to faith, ethical behaviour,
confidence, and insight into the teaching,
remembering the instructions of the Buddhas.’”

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha,…

suttaplex.blurb: The gods complain when a poor man is reborn in heaven. But Sakka points out that even though poor, he did many good deeds.
